channel.title: pip3 on Some Title
channel.description: Recent content in pip3 on Some Title

item.title: [pip3] ImportError occurs
item.description: An error occurs when executing the # `pip3` command. ImportError: cannot import name’pkg_resources’ from’pip._vendor’ Cause pkg_resources is not in the pip._vendor package When I checked with the CLI whether the package actually existed, it was found to exist. And when I checked the location of the file, I found that it did not exist in the directory managed by pip. Confirm existence of file Python 3.7.7 (default, Mar 10 2020, 15:43:33) [Clang 11.

item.title: A note for when pip3 has been installed with python2.7 for some reason
item.description: I want to install a package using pip3 for python3, but for some reason, the python version of pip3 is python2.7 and I get an error that the package cannot be installed by python3. ~:python3 -V Python 3.7.4 ~/program/scrape: pip3 -V pip 20.0.2 from /Users/eijikudo/Library/Python/2.7/lib/python/site-packages/pip (python 2.7) python3.7 -m pip install package name It was done after specifying the python version and installing. You can do this. .. ..
